p: The responses of B. pilosa and E. crus-galli to P. cubeba and P. nigrum EOs treatments in lipid peroxidation accumulations were presented in Figure 3. Lipid peroxidation, expressed as malondialdehyde (MDA) contents, were increased significantly in both EOs treatments compared with control. Accumulation of MDA in E. crus-galli was the highest as responses of EOs treatments. Compared with P. nigrum EO, P. cubeba EO gave more stimulation effects in MDA accumulation both in B. pilosa and E. cruss-galli. P. cubeba EO induced MDA accumulation both in B. pilosa and E. crus-galli by 37.46 and 50.18% in the roots and 11.26 and 10.82% in the aerial parts respectively.
